docs.lead_paragraph: Abortions have declined in states where new laws make it harder to have them — but they've also waned in states where abortion rights are protected, an Associated Press survey finds. Nearly everywhere, in red states and blue, abortions are down since 2010.

headline.main: AP Exclusive: Abortions Declining in Nearly All States
headline.print_headline: AP Exclusive: Abortions Declining in Nearly All States

docs.snippet: Abortions have declined in states where new laws make it harder to have them — but they've also waned in states where abortion rights are protected, an Associated Press survey finds. Nearly everywhere, in red states and blue, abortions are down...

docs.lead_paragraph: A coalition of religious and human rights leaders demanded the aid for girls and women raped by fighters for groups like the Islamic State and Boko Haram.

headline.main: Religious Leaders Urge U.S. to Fund Abortions for Rape Victims in Conflicts Abroad
headline.print_headline: Religious Coalition Wants U.S. to Pay for Abortions for Terrorist Rape Victims

docs.abstract: Coalition of religious and human rights leaders demand that Pres Obama support abortion financing for women raped in overseas conflicts involving terrorist groups like the Islamic State and Boko Haram; group, who have rolled out stark advertising campaign on issue, say Obama has spoken compassionately on issue while doing little.
docs.snippet: A coalition of religious and human rights leaders demanded the aid for girls and women raped by fighters for groups like the Islamic State and Boko Haram.

keywords.value: United States Agency for International Development
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Though other states have also struggled to establish exchanges, Vermont, which saw the law as a bridge to a single-payer system, has acutely felt its problems.

headline.main: In Vermont, Frustrations Mount Over Affordable Care Act
headline.print_headline: Barely Meeting a Law It Hoped to Transcend

docs.abstract: Vermont, which once saw Affordable Care Act as mere stepping stone on path to universal, single-payer health care, is now struggling to meet law's requirements; state's online insurance marketplace is still not fully functional despite $200 million in federal funds, and public enthusiasm for long-term plan has waned so significantly that state Democrats have shelved it.
docs.snippet: Though other states have also struggled to establish exchanges, Vermont, which saw the law as a bridge to a single-payer system, has acutely felt its problems.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Arizona abortion providers asked a federal judge Thursday to block part of a recently passed law that would require doctors to tell women they can reverse the effects of a drug-induced abortion.

headline.main: Planned Parenthood Sues Arizona Over New Abortion Law
headline.print_headline: Planned Parenthood Sues Arizona Over New Abortion Law

docs.snippet: Arizona abortion providers asked a federal judge Thursday to block part of a recently passed law that would require doctors to tell women they can reverse the effects of a drug-induced abortion.
